items.title: Images have been compressed with Webflow's built-in WebP conversion tool.
items.description:
Compressing images makes them smaller, which reduces the weight of your pages and makes your site load faster.

Webflow offers a built-in tool to convert all of your images to WebP and compress them, all at once.

We recommend you convert all of your images except SVGs, which are already light and scalable by nature.

If the WebP version of an image is larger than the original, Webflow will automatically revert it to the original, so you can use this tool on all of your images without any issues.

To use Webflow's WebP conversion tool, expand the Assets panel, select your images and click the Compress button.

items.title: Minification of CSS, HTML and Javascript is enabled.
items.description:
Minifying your site's code reduces the weight of your page, which makes your site load faster.

If you are hosting your website on Webflow, there is no downside to enabling minification of CSS, Javascript and HTML: it can only help your loading speeds.

items.title: Unused classes are cleaned up.
items.description:
Removing unused classes from your site reduces the weight of your website's code and improve your site's performance.

You can clean up all of your project's unused classes in one fell swoop by using the _Clean up_ button in Webflow's style manager.

items.title: Unused interactions and animations are cleaned up.
items.description:
Removing unused interactions and animations from your site reduces the weight of your website's code and improve your site's performance.

You can clean up all of your project's unused classes in one fell swoop by using the _Clean up_ button in Webflow's style manager.

items.title: Unused fonts are removed.
items.description:
Removing unused fonts from your site reduces the weight of your website's code and improve your site's performance.

You can see and manage which fonts your website is including in the Fonts tab of your project settings.

items.title: Webflow.io subdomain indexing is disabled
items.description:
When developing and updating your website, the .webflow.io subdomain is used as a preview for you and your team. However, you don't want Google and other search engines to index this site if you are using a custom domain.

To prevent Google from indexing the .webflow.io development website, check the "Disable Webflow sudomain indexing" in the SEO tab of your project settings.

items.title: A default domain is defined.
items.description:
When your website is published to many different custom domains without having a default domain set up, search engines may flag your site as offering "duplicate content".

To prevent SEO issues and to standardize your visitors browsing experience, select a default domain in your project's settings.

When a domain is defined as the default, all your other custom domains will redirect to the default domain.

It is recommended that you use a domain with the `www.` prefix as the default to avoid potential SSL issues.
